data.title: Best Cajun Food in Fort Collins
data.text: We visited the location on a Sunday afternoon after driving from the Denver Tech Center 90 miles to give the place a try. Long drive on I-25 but the visit to The Lost Cajun was worth it. Nice interior decor, friendly service, sample plate was a good representation of what to expect, and the food was great. I had a bowl of the chicken and sausage gumbo that comes with rice and a few pieces of buttered bread that was plenty filling and very reasonably priced. My wife had the fried shrimp plate that came with fried shrimp that had a nice cajun flavor, fries that also had a good seasoning, some tartar sauce, a lemon slice and 3 pieces of buttered bread. At first it didn't appear that it would be enough, but she felt full after eating the meal and said it was just right. Another nice thing is they don't have music blaring so loud you have to talk over it. Easy to get to location with plenty of parking in the area. We'll be back.

data.title: Amazing!!
data.text: I visited here with my family to celebrate my birthday, we walked in and our waitress was the owner, she was very friendly and helpful! The atmosphere was wonderful and the food was amazing! Very authentic; We're already planning to come here again the next time we're down in Fort Collins.

data.title: Great Cajun Food!
data.text: We had Red Beans and Rice, Seafood Platter and a Po Boy. Everything tasted great and the service was terrific. As first timers there, we really appreciated the sample assortment. Very much looking forward to future visits!

data.title: Authentic
data.text: First time, really delicious.  My husband went to college at Louisiana Tech so pretty picky with Cajun food.   Neat restaurant,  outside dining a plus.  We started with fried pickles and followed with the generous lunch special.   Loved the decor and vibe.  Next visit will be pasta with fried chicken.  Yum!!

data.title: If you like cajun and creole
data.text:
Brought us a few small sampler cups to start (no charge) so that we could decide on the flavor for our entree. We were there mid afternoon during the week and they were not busy but when we finished people were getting off work and filtering in.
The food is really good and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Of the three cajun places I have tried in Fort Collins and Loveland I like this one best. This will be my go to place for cajun.
First time you go be sure to tell them it is your first time and hopefully they will give you the little sampler as well. The bread they serve with entrees is great and the beignet was also delicious. They also had at least one beer from Louisianna

data.title: Love the shrimp Po boy!!
data.text: Love the shrimp Po Boy although my husband loves their fried oysters.  Fries have an excellent seasoning as well. Fun, energetic atmosphere. Have been there several times and love it every time.

data.title: Wonderful !
data.text:
From the time you walk up to the front door you are greeted with the Cajun experience ... Awesome Cajun music ... Wonderful, friendly staff ... A sample tray is brought out so you can see what your taste buds want ... Very hard since it is all awesome .. My new favorite restaurant ..visited 4 times and every time is a wonderful experience ...
Keep up the great work !!

data.title: Great Southern Style Restaurant
data.text: The Lost Cajun provided a really great experience for getting acquainted to southern food, which is fairly unfamiliar to the average Colorado eater. They started by giving us a sampler tray, which they do if you are new to the restaurant and it gives you a chance to try some of their different menu items. Then the waitress, who was very hospitable, helped us sort through the menu to find a good pick for each of us. Since I'm not much of a seafood fan I went for the Fried Chicken Po Boy, which was great! Our waitress checked in with us regularly so we felt well attended to. The restaurant itself is also pretty new, so the place looks great and also has an overall excellent atmosphere.

data.title: "Fort Collins needs this"
data.text:
We have a lot of options to eat out in this city and this brings a fun taste of the south to us.  (It's really kinda weird that it's catty-corner from Lucille's, one of my other Southern food faves for 20 years.)

But let's get to the food shall we? I found it to be authentic from my recollections of several trips to "Nawlins" in the early 90's. It's rich food it has a great depth of taste to it.  A lot of it is fried so I feel that some of the Fort's highfalutin citizens will turn their noses up at it.

It's other plus is that it's not jockeying for attention on College Ave. or campus west, so parking is much easier. 

My wife and I really liked it and will return soon.

data.title: Grab a drink or early dinner before a performance at Lincoln Center
data.text:
The Lost Cajun is located across the street from Lincoln Center, a local concert venue. If you are attending an event at Lincoln Center, or just want a taste of New Orleans cooking, then a visit to The Lost Cajun is worth a try. 

There is a full bar, that offers hurricane drinks, just like on Canal Street. 

The restaurant offers a small taste of various gumbo's, affording you the opportunity to decide how much spice you're taste buds can handle. They also serve the best Beignets in Fort Collins, and in New Orleans )sorry Cafe Du Mode & Morning Call) for that matter.  Their beignets are hot out of the frier, light, fluffy, covered in powder sugar and are rectangle shaped.

data.title: If you like Cajun food, give it a try!
data.text:
Let me preface this review by saying that I am extremely picky about my Cajun and Creole food. My father's family is from New Orleans and I've been treated to fantastic, authentic food my whole life.

That said, most "Cajun" restaurants in Colorado are just plain sad. So, I went into The Lost Cajun with somewhat limited expectations. I was pleasantly surprised! I've been twice now so have tried a number of things. The red beans & rice is quite good (not as good as my grandmother's but c'mon). The gumbos were all pretty authentic-tasting. The etoufee was the only thing that was disappointing. But the shimmering star - for me - was the roast beef po boy. SO AUTHENTIC! I gobbled it down in all of its messy goodness.

They have a fun (dangerous?) drink selection and a casual atmosphere. I'll be back.

data.title: Valentine's Day
data.text: Girlfriend and I went here on Valentine's Day and it remains as one of my favorite places to eat in Fort Collins. Service was A+ and so is the food

data.title: Fried Fries Fried Bar food
data.text: We really looked forward to a different lunch....and it was...Fried shrimp...tasted like fried shrimp...nothing special. Definitely bar food. If they pushed this as more of a bar and less of a restaurant, they might make it. Otherwise...I can't see us there again! Service was bad too...seriously. ...so much potential in it....work it into a sports bar with same theme...might work for you!

data.title: Be treated like royalty!
data.text: We visited The Lost Cajun for the first time and are destined to be long term customers.  The food is really good--catfish, lobster bisque, shrimp, crawfish, red beans and rice--every thing you could want in a cajun restaurant.  They even bring sample cups to try before you order.  But the absolute best part of this place is the owner and his staff. I think every single staff member in the restaurant stopped by the check on us, and the owner stopped by the make sure the staff was doing a good job!

data.title: Second visit, not as good as first...
data.text:
Visited the Lost Cajun for lunch with colleagues and liked it enough to want to have my husband give it a try because he loves fried shrimp.  At lunch the food was fresh and the place was fun.  When I returned with my husband for dinner, it was after happy hour was done and the tables were still full so we had to sit at the bar.  Service was not very good and the sampler that they brought so my husband could try the gumbos and jambalaya was really messy and looked like it had been held for far too long.  The sampler is a great idea, but not if it is such a poor representation of the product.

The bartender was friendly, but didn't listen when orders were placed.  We ordered an appetizer at her suggestion, but then it was brought out along with our meals, not in advance so we could enjoy it with our drinks.  I ordered the Lobster Bisque which was very good, but it was supposed to be served with French bread.  The bread that was served with it was two pieces of what started out as French bread, but somehow ended up flattened like a cracker and about the same size.  The server didn't even pay attention to what she was serving and when she asked how our meals were, she didn't listen to the response and continued to tell us how wonderful everything is when it obviously wasn't.

My husband ordered the fried shrimp and asked for it without the cole slaw, when his food arrived, there were 6 small shrimp on a very small bed of fries and a big glob of cole slaw.  His French bread pieces were a bit thicker than mine, but still pretty small.   I guess $10.99 isn't a bad price if the product was a little larger.  My husband had to go home and make a sandwich because he was still hungry and he is not a large man who eats a lot.

Love the menu and the concept, but we were very disappointed in the product and service and will not return.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: The best Fried Catfish & oysters that I can remember.  I will be back, is the best compliment I can give a restaurant.

data.title: Good Cajun, prices, service, drinks, lighting
data.text: As a new customer, they serve you a 6 item sampler for free to get you familiar with their unique seasonings! Fishnet decor and solid wood seating is in keeping with this straight forward Cajun country seasoning find. Not overcooked, seasonings nicely crafted, strong flavorful drinks (swamp water and hurricane), and friendly wait staff made an enjoyable night out. Seafood platter (deep fried battered oysters, shrimp, catfish), savory seafood gumbo, and cat-touffee were very good! Dessert is limited to beignets. Outdoor patio will be a popular spot when Winter wanes.

data.title: New Fave
data.text: My wife and I decided to try the Lost Cajun for the first time and were not disappointed. They started us off with a sample of six of their dishes to help with our selections. We settled on the Chicken and Sausage Gumbo, Boudin Balls, and Gator Bites. They were all cooked well and flavored perfectly. We then had to try the Beignets and they were excellent as well. The atmosphere was very laid back and the service was excellent. We will be back frequently.

data.title: Great Cajun Food
data.text: We stop here by chance and found it to be the best place I have found in Fort Collins. The food was fantastic and the service was way beyond expectations. If you are near here it is well worth the stop.

data.title: Best Night Ever
data.text: Great place. Great prices. Great people. I can't get enough of The Lost Cajun. The shrimp po boy is awesome and the hurricanes remind me of bourbon street. The owner (woman) is a sweetheart and the bar staff is one of the best in foco. Eat here you won't be disappointed!!
